meanings.definition: To restrain or confine with a rope or chain.
meanings.sent1: The farmer spancelled the goat to keep it from wandering off.
meanings.sent2: The dog was spancelled to the tree to prevent it from running away.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten spancelled the toy mouse to play a prank on its owner.
meanings.sent4: Her fear spancelled her, preventing her from taking risks and trying new things.
meanings.sent5: The spider spancelled its prey with silk, ready to feast on its catch.

meanings.definition: Restrained or confined with a rope or chain.
meanings.sent1: The spancelled horse stood still in the field.
meanings.sent2: The spancelled prisoner could only move within a limited area.
meanings.sent3: The spancelled balloon floated gently in the sky, unable to soar freely.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt spancelled, trapped in a web of emotions.
meanings.sent5: The spancelled ship was anchored securely to the dock, unable to sail away.
